newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Fuel Oil- Soft, 180-cst support at $103.50/T.
newsitem.headline: Asia Fuel Oil- Soft, 180-cst support at $103.50/T.

text.p: The Singapore high sulphur fuel oil market was a little soft on Tuesday after the 180-cst grade failed to break the $103.5-per-tonne barrier in the past few days, traders said.
The 180-cst was offered at $103.00 per tonne but there was no buyers. Traders said a major has been offering the 180-cst in the past few days, trying to get rid of its June stocks.
The market has largely discounted the impact of tight summer supplies from the Middle East.
Two to three cargoes from the Mediterranean were heard to arrive in Singapore in the second half of June, adding supplies to this region, traders said.
"Supply and demand look quite balanced at this moment," said one trader.
The 180-cst grade has been capped by the $103.50-per-tonne level, with the last two cargoes traded at $103.50 per tonne last Tuesday.
Industry sources said the local trader who bought at least five cargoes in the past two weeks has stopped its purchase, reversing the previous uptrend momentum.
National Iranian Oil Co (NIOC) has renewed its annual fuel oil term sale contracts with two Singapore companies, Hin Leong Trading and Kuo International for 1997/1998.
Under the contract for March 1997 to February 1998 liftings, Hin Leong will take four cargoes and Kuo two cargoes per month. Each cargo is between 75,000 and 90,000 tonnes.
Taiwan's state Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) will announce on Wednesday the result for a tender to sell a third 30,000-tonne cargo of 3.0-percent sulphur fuel oil for June lifting.
Traders expected the awarded price at around $100.00 per tonne, compared with CPC's last awarded level at $101.00.
Despite the relatively firm swaps market, "the cargo market sentiment may become a little weak from now on if no additional demand comes out," said one trader.
June swaps were last quoted at $100.25/$101.00 against Monday's $101.75/$101.25.
In the LSWR market, the Korean Electric Power Company (KEPCO) has issued a tender to buy one 500,000-barrel cargo of 0.3-percent LSWR for July delivery, a KEPCO source said.
The tender, which seeks to buy the cargo for delivery July 18-22 to the ports of Ulsan or Pusan, will close on June 5 and is valid for a day, the source said.

"The tender is for July cargo, which won't help the current bearish sentiment," said one trader, noting the market was still waiting for Japan's summer demand to emerge to digest current ample supplies.
(Prices in dollars per tonne, unless stated)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
JUL FUEL OIL SWAPS 98.50/99.50 99.00/99.50
*Dollars per barrel
-- Singapore newsroom (+65-870 3571)
